title: Compliance 101 Final Exam
description: Demonstrate your understanding of platform compliance, age verification, prohibited content, and reporting procedures.

questions.question: Which law requires mandatory CSAM reporting to NCMEC within 24 hours?
questions.explanation: 18 U.S.C. § 2258A requires electronic service providers to report apparent CSAM to NCMEC within 24 hours of detection.

questions.question: What is the maximum penalty for UK Online Safety Act violations?
questions.explanation: The UK Online Safety Act 2023 allows for fines up to £18 million or 10% of worldwide annual revenue, whichever is higher.

questions.question: How many US states currently require age verification for adult content?
questions.explanation: As of 2024, 8 US states require age verification: Louisiana, Utah, Arkansas, Virginia, Mississippi, Texas, Montana, and North Carolina.

questions.question: What federal law addresses platform liability for facilitating trafficking?
questions.explanation: FOSTA-SESTA (Allow States and Victims to Fight Online Sex Trafficking Act) was enacted in 2018 and makes platforms potentially liable for facilitating sex trafficking.

questions.question: What is the EU's comprehensive data protection law called?
questions.explanation: GDPR (General Data Protection Regulation) is the EU's comprehensive data protection law that came into effect in 2018, with penalties up to €20 million or 4% of global revenue.

questions.question: Which age verification method is recommended for best privacy protection?
questions.explanation: VerifyMy is recommended because Fanz only receives verification status (yes/no), not your actual ID documents, providing the highest privacy protection.

questions.question: How long must age verification records be kept under 18 U.S.C. § 2257?
questions.explanation: 18 U.S.C. § 2257 requires age verification and performer identity records to be retained for 7 years from the last use or activity.

questions.question: What is the typical processing time for VerifyMy verification?
questions.explanation: VerifyMy verification typically takes 2-5 minutes to complete and process.

questions.question: True or False: You can use someone else's ID for age verification.
questions.explanation: False. Using someone else's ID is fraud and will result in permanent ban and potential legal action. Verification must use your own valid ID.

questions.question: If you're verified on one Fanz platform using FanzSSO, what happens on other Fanz platforms?
options: You need to pay for each platform
questions.explanation: When using FanzSSO (single sign-on), your age verification status carries across all Fanz ecosystem platforms automatically.

questions.question: How many prohibited content categories are there on Fanz platforms?
questions.explanation: There are 9 prohibited content categories: CSAM, appearing to depict minors, incest, bestiality, non-consensual content, necrophilia, bodily waste, extreme violence, and human trafficking.

questions.question: What risk score threshold triggers automatic content blocking?
questions.explanation: Content with a risk score of 80 or higher is automatically blocked from upload and requires immediate review.

questions.question: True or False: Incest roleplay is allowed if all participants are verified 18+.
questions.explanation: False. All incest content, including roleplay and step-family scenarios, is prohibited by payment processors regardless of participant ages.

questions.question: What happens after a third content violation?
questions.explanation: The third strike results in permanent account termination, potential forfeiture of earnings, and reporting to authorities if legally required.

questions.question: Which organization enforces payment processor content requirements?
questions.explanation: Payment processors like Visa and Mastercard enforce their Global Brand Protection Program (GBPP) requirements. Platforms that violate these rules lose payment processing.

questions.question: How do you report concerning content on Fanz?
options: Post about it on social media
Click the three-dot menu and select 'Report'
questions.explanation: Every piece of content has a report option in the three-dot menu (...). Click it and select 'Report' to submit your report.

questions.question: What happens if you repeatedly submit false reports?
questions.explanation: False reporting wastes moderator resources. Patterns of false reporting result in warnings, and repeated false reporting leads to account restrictions.

questions.question: If you see suspected CSAM, what should you do?
options: Report immediately without downloading or sharing
Wait to see if it's removed
questions.explanation: Report immediately using the CSAM/Minor Safety option. Do NOT download, screenshot, or share the content. Do not confront the uploader.

questions.question: True or False: The person you report can see that you reported them.
questions.explanation: False. Reports are anonymous to the reported user. Only moderators and the compliance team can see reporter identity.

questions.question: How long does GDPR give platforms to respond to data subject requests?
questions.explanation: GDPR Article 12 requires platforms to respond to data subject requests (access, erasure, etc.) within 30 days of receipt.

uponPassing: Recommended to complete Creator Compliance course before posting content
uponFailing: Recommended to review specific modules before retaking
